trans-unit.source: DSC WindowsFeatureSet Resource
trans-unit.target: DSC WindowsFeatureSet Resource

trans-unit.source: powershell,DSC
trans-unit.target: powershell,DSC

trans-unit.source: DSC WindowsFeatureSet Resource
trans-unit.target: DSC WindowsFeatureSet Resource

trans-unit.source: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 4.0, Windows PowerShell 5.0
trans-unit.target: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 4.0, Windows PowerShell 5.0

trans-unit.source: The **WindowsFeatureSet** resource in Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to ensure that roles and features are added or removed on a target node.
trans-unit.target: The **WindowsFeatureSet** resource in Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to ensure that roles and features are added or removed on a target node.

trans-unit.source: This resource is a [composite resource](authoringResourceComposite.md) that calls the [WindowsFeature resource](windowsfeatureResource.md) for each feature specified in the `Name` property.
trans-unit.target: This resource is a [composite resource](authoringResourceComposite.md) that calls the [WindowsFeature resource](windowsfeatureResource.md) for each feature specified in the `Name` property.

trans-unit.source: Use this resource when you want to configure a number of Windows Features to the same state.
trans-unit.target: Use this resource when you want to configure a number of Windows Features to the same state.

trans-unit.source: Syntax
trans-unit.target: Syntax

trans-unit.source: Properties
trans-unit.target: Properties

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: The names of the roles or features that you want to ensure are added or removed.
trans-unit.target: The names of the roles or features that you want to ensure are added or removed.

trans-unit.source: This is the same as the **Name** property of the [Get-WindowsFeature](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj205469.aspx) cmdlet, and not the display name of the roles or features.
trans-unit.target: This is the same as the **Name** property of the [Get-WindowsFeature](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj205469.aspx) cmdlet, and not the display name of the roles or features.

trans-unit.source: Credential
trans-unit.target: Credential

trans-unit.source: The credentials to use to add or remove the roles or features.
trans-unit.target: The credentials to use to add or remove the roles or features.

trans-unit.source: Ensure
trans-unit.target: Ensure

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether the roles or features are added.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether the roles or features are added.

trans-unit.source: To ensure that the roles or features are added, set this property to "Present" To ensure that the roles or features are removed, set the property to "Absent".
trans-unit.target: To ensure that the roles or features are added, set this property to "Present" To ensure that the roles or features are removed, set the property to "Absent".

trans-unit.source: IncludeAllSubFeature
trans-unit.target: IncludeAllSubFeature

trans-unit.source: Set this property to **$true** to include all required subfeatures with of the features you specify with the **Name** property.
trans-unit.target: Set this property to **$true** to include all required subfeatures with of the features you specify with the **Name** property.

trans-unit.source: LogPath
trans-unit.target: LogPath

trans-unit.source: The path to a log file where you want the resource provider to log the operation.
trans-unit.target: The path to a log file where you want the resource provider to log the operation.

trans-unit.source: DependsOn
trans-unit.target: DependsOn

trans-unit.source: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.
trans-unit.target: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the ID of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is __ResourceName__ and its type is __ResourceType__, the syntax for using this property is `DependsOn = "[ResourceType]ResourceName"`.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the ID of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is __ResourceName__ and its type is __ResourceType__, the syntax for using this property is `DependsOn = "[ResourceType]ResourceName"`.

trans-unit.source: Source
trans-unit.target: Source

trans-unit.source: Indicates the location of the source file to use for installation, if necessary.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the location of the source file to use for installation, if necessary.

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: The following configuration ensures that the **Web-Server** (IIS) and **SMTP Server** features, and all subfeatures of each, are installed.
trans-unit.target: The following configuration ensures that the **Web-Server** (IIS) and **SMTP Server** features, and all subfeatures of each, are installed.
